</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p856 ft80">CHAPTER III</P>
<P class="p857 ft89">GENERAL PROVISIONS ON THE VERIFICATION OF THE SAFETY FEATURES</P>
<P class="p858 ft86">Article 10</P>
<P class="p859 ft88">Verification of the safety features</P>
<P class="p549 ft82">When verifying the safety features, manufacturers, wholesalers and persons authorised or entitled to supply medicinal products to the public shall verify the following:</P>
<P class="p515 ft82"><SPAN class="ft91">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft117">the authenticity of the unique identifier;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p543 ft82"><SPAN class="ft91">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft104">the integrity of the </SPAN><NOBR>anti-tampering</NOBR> device.</P>
<P class="p860 ft86">Article 11</P>
<P class="p861 ft88">Verification of the authenticity of the unique identifier</P>
<P class="p613 ft93">When verifying the authenticity of a unique identifier, manufacturers, wholesalers and persons authorised or entitled to supply medicinal products to the public shall check the unique identifier against the unique identifiers stored in the repositories system referred to in Article 31. A unique identifier shall be considered authentic when the repositories system contains an active unique identifier with the product code and serial number that are identical to those of the unique identifier being verified.</P>
<P class="p862 ft86">Article 12</P>
<P class="p863 ft88">Unique identifiers which have been decommissioned</P>
<P class="p864 ft82">A medicinal product bearing a unique identifier which has been decommissioned shall not be further distributed or supplied to the public except in any of the following situations:</P>
<P class="p865 ft82"><SPAN class="ft91">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft104">the unique identifier was decommissioned in accordance with Article 22(a) and the medicinal product is distributed for the purpose of exporting it outside the Union;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p865 ft82"><SPAN class="ft91">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft105">the unique identifier was decommissioned earlier than the time of supplying the medicinal product to the public, pursuant to Articles 23, 26, 28 or 41;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p865 ft82"><SPAN class="ft91">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft104">the unique identifier was decommissioned in accordance with Article 22(b) or (c) or Article 40, and the medicinal product is provided to the person responsible for its disposal;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p865 ft82"><SPAN class="ft91">(d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft105">the unique identifier was decommissioned in accordance with Article 22(d) and the medicinal product is provided to the national competent authorities.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p651 ft86">Article 13</P>
<P class="p553 ft88">Reversing the status of a decommissioned unique identifier</P>
<P class="p866 ft80"><SPAN class="ft80">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft120">Manufacturers, wholesalers and persons authorised or entitled to supply medicinal products to the public may only revert the status of a decommissioned unique identifier to an active status if the following conditions are fulfilled:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p816 ft82"><SPAN class="ft91">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft117">the person performing the reverting operation is covered by the same authorisation or entitlement and operates in the same premises as the person that decommissioned the unique identifier;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p575 ft82"><SPAN class="ft91">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft105">the reverting of the status takes place not more than 10 days after the unique identifier was decommissioned;</SPAN></P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p13 ft79">119</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_120">
<DIV id="p120dimg1">
<INGENBILD zsrc="H603106120x1.jpg/" id="p120img1">
</DIV>


<DIV class="dclr"></DIV>
<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p13 ft79">Prop. 2018/19:106</P>
<P class="p13 ft79">Bilaga 2</P>
<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t48">
<TR>
	<TD rowspan=2 class="tr31 td83"><P class="p439 ft80">9.2.2016</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr7 td114"><P class="p1 ft81"> </P></TD>
	<TD rowspan=2 class="tr31 td119"><P class="p772 ft82">Official Journal of the European Union</P></TD>
	<TD rowspan=2 class="tr31 td172"><P class="p1 ft80">L 32/11</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr21 td116"><P class="p326 ft83">EN</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr27 td112"><P class="p1 ft84"> </P></TD>
	<TD class="tr27 td114"><P class="p1 ft84"> </P></TD>
	<TD class="tr27 td121"><P class="p1 ft84"> </P></TD>
	<TD class="tr27 td173"><P class="p1 ft84"> </P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p502 ft82"><SPAN class="ft91">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft117">the pack of medicinal product has not expired;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p867 ft82"><SPAN class="ft91">(d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft104">the pack of medicinal product has not been registered in the repositories system as recalled, withdrawn, intended for destruction or stolen and the person performing the reverting operation does not have knowledge that the pack is stolen;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p562 ft82"><SPAN class="ft91">(e)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft117">the medicinal product has not been supplied to the public.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p833 ft82"><SPAN class="ft80">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft115">Medicinal products bearing a unique identifier which cannot be reverted to an active status because the conditions set out in paragraph 1 are not fulfilled shall not be returned to saleable stock.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p868 ft80">CHAPTER IV</P>
<P class="p869 ft89">MODALITIES OF VERIFICATION OF THE SAFETY FEATURES AND DECOMMISSIONING OF THE UNIQUE</P>
<P class="p870 ft89">IDENTIFIER BY MANUFACTURERS</P>
<P class="p871 ft86">Article 14</P>
<P class="p872 ft88">Verification of the <NOBR>two-dimensional</NOBR> barcode</P>
<P class="p873 ft82">The manufacturer placing the safety features shall verify that the <NOBR>two-dimensional</NOBR> barcode carrying the unique identifier complies with Articles 5 and 6, is readable and contains the correct information.</P>
<P class="p874 ft86">Article 15</P>
<P class="p875 ft88">Record keeping</P>
<P class="p876 ft80">The manufacturer placing the safety features shall keep records of every operation he performs with or on the unique identifier on a pack of medicinal product for at least one year after the expiry date of the pack or five years after the pack has been released for sale or distribution in accordance with Article 51(3) of Directive 2001/83/EC, whichever is the longer period, and shall provide those records to competent authorities on request.</P>
<P class="p877 ft86">Article 16</P>
<P class="p878 ft88">Verifications to be performed before removing or replacing the safety features</P>
<P class="p879 ft82"><SPAN class="ft80">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft115">Before removing or covering, either fully or partially, the safety features in accordance with Article 47a of Directive 2001/83/EC, the manufacturer shall verify the following:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p502 ft82"><SPAN class="ft91">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft117">the integrity of the </SPAN><NOBR>anti-tampering</NOBR> device;</P>
<P class="p826 ft82"><SPAN class="ft91">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft104">the authenticity of the unique identifier and decommission it if replaced.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p631 ft80"><SPAN class="ft80">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft116">Manufacturers holding both a manufacturing authorisation according to Article 40 of Directive 2001/83/EC and an authorisation to manufacture or import investigational medicinal products to the Union as referred to in Article 61 of Regulation (EU) No 536/2014 of the European Parliament and of the Council (</SPAN><SPAN class="ft95">1</SPAN>) shall verify the safety features and decommission the unique identifier on a pack of medicinal product before repackaging or <NOBR>re-labelling</NOBR> it for the purpose of using it as authorised investigational medicinal product or authorised auxiliary medicinal product.</P>
<P class="p880 ft80">(<SPAN class="ft95">1</SPAN>) Regulation (EU) No 536/2014 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 16 April 2014 on clinical trials on medicinal products for human use, and repealing Directive 2001/20/EC (OJ L 158, 27.5.2014, p. 1).</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p13 ft79">120</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_121">
<DIV id="p121dimg1">
<INGENBILD zsrc="H603106121x1.jpg/" id="p121img1">
</DIV>


<DIV class="dclr"></DIV>
<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p437 ft79">Prop. 2018/19:106</P>
<P class="p438 ft79">Bilaga 2</P>
<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t49">
<TR>
	<TD rowspan=2 class="tr31 td83"><P class="p1 ft82">L 32/12</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr7 td109"><P class="p1 ft81"> </P></TD>
	<TD rowspan=2 class="tr31 td169"><P class="p787 ft82">Official Journal of the European Union</P></TD>
	<TD rowspan=2 class="tr31 td33"><P class="p10 ft82">9.2.2016</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr21 td111"><P class="p326 ft83">EN</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr27 td112"><P class="p1 ft84"> </P></TD>
	<TD class="tr27 td109"><P class="p1 ft84"> </P></TD>
	<TD class="tr27 td170"><P class="p1 ft84"> </P></TD>
	<TD class="tr27 td171"><P class="p1 ft84"> </P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p881 ft86">Article 17</P>
<P class="p882 ft88">Equivalent unique identifier</P>
<P class="p883 ft80">When placing an equivalent unique identifier for the purposes of complying with Article 47a(1)(b) of Directive 2001/83/EC, the manufacturer shall verify that the structure and composition of the unique identifier placed on the packaging complies, with regard to the product code and the national reimbursement number or other national number identifying the medicinal product, with the requirements of the Member State where the medicinal product is intended to be placed on the market, so that that unique identifier can be verified for authenticity and decommissioned.</P>
<P class="p884 ft86">Article 18</P>
<P class="p885 ft88">Actions to be taken by manufacturers in case of tampering or suspected falsification</P>
<P class="p590 ft80">Where a manufacturer has reason to believe that the packaging of the medicinal product has been tampered with, or the verification of the safety features shows that the product may not be authentic, the manufacturer shall not release the product for sale or distribution and shall immediately inform the relevant competent authorities.</P>
<P class="p884 ft86">Article 19</P>
<P class="p886 ft88">Provisions applicable to a manufacturer distributing his products by wholesale</P>
<P class="p617 ft82">Where a manufacturer distributes his products by wholesale, Article 20(a), and Articles 22, 23 and 24 shall apply to him in addition to Articles 14 to 18.</P>
<P class="p887 ft80">CHAPTER V</P>
<P class="p888 ft89">MODALITIES OF VERIFICATION OF THE SAFETY FEATURES AND DECOMMISSIONING OF THE UNIQUE</P>
<P class="p106 ft89">IDENTIFIER BY WHOLESALERS</P>
<P class="p881 ft86">Article 20</P>
<P class="p889 ft88">Verification of the authenticity of the unique identifier by wholesalers</P>
<P class="p677 ft82">A wholesaler shall verify the authenticity of the unique identifier of at least the following medicinal products in his physical possession:</P>
<P class="p890 ft82"><SPAN class="ft91">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft117">medicinal products returned to him by persons authorised or entitled to supply medicinal products to the public or by another wholesaler;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p891 ft80"><SPAN class="ft91">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft113">medicinal products he receives from a wholesaler who is neither the manufacturer nor the wholesaler holding the marketing authorisation nor a wholesaler who is designated by the marketing authorisation holder, by means of a written contract, to store and distribute the products covered by his marketing authorisation on his behalf.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p858 ft86">Article 21</P>
<P class="p892 ft88">Derogations from Article 20(b)</P>
<P class="p750 ft82">Verification of the authenticity of the unique identifier of a medicinal product is not required under Article 20(b) in any of the following situations:</P>
<P class="p732 ft82"><SPAN class="ft91">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft117">that medicinal product changes ownership but remains in the physical possession of the same wholesaler;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p893 ft82"><SPAN class="ft91">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft104">that medicinal product is distributed within the territory of a Member State between two warehouses belonging to the same wholesaler or the same legal entity, and no sale takes place.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p894 ft86">Article 22</P>
<P class="p895 ft88">Decommissioning of unique identifiers by wholesalers</P>
<P class="p543 ft82">A wholesaler shall verify the authenticity of and decommission the unique identifier of the following medicinal products:</P>
<P class="p513 ft82"><SPAN class="ft91">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft117">products which he intends to distribute outside of the Union;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p893 ft82"><SPAN class="ft91">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft104">products which have been returned to him by persons authorised or entitled to supply medicinal products to the public or another wholesaler and cannot be returned to saleable stock;</SPAN></P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p13 ft79">121</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_122">
<DIV id="p122dimg1">
<INGENBILD zsrc="H603106122x1.jpg/" id="p122img1">
</DIV>


<DIV class="dclr"></DIV>
<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p13 ft79">Prop. 2018/19:106</P>
<P class="p13 ft79">Bilaga 2</P>
<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t48">
<TR>
	<TD rowspan=2 class="tr31 td83"><P class="p439 ft80">9.2.2016</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr7 td114"><P class="p1 ft81"> </P></TD>
	<TD rowspan=2 class="tr31 td119"><P class="p772 ft82">Official Journal of the European Union</P></TD>
	<TD rowspan=2 class="tr31 td172"><P class="p1 ft80">L 32/13</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr21 td116"><P class="p326 ft83">EN</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr27 td112"><P class="p1 ft84"> </P></TD>
	<TD class="tr27 td114"><P class="p1 ft84"> </P></TD>
	<TD class="tr27 td121"><P class="p1 ft84"> </P></TD>
	<TD class="tr27 td173"><P class="p1 ft84"> </P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p502 ft82"><SPAN class="ft91">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft117">products which are intended for destruction;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p542 ft82"><SPAN class="ft91">(d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft104">products which, while in his physical possession, are requested as a sample by competent authorities;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p896 ft82"><SPAN class="ft91">(e)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft117">products which he intends to distribute to the persons or institutions referred to in Article 23, where required by national legislation in accordance with the same Article.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p897 ft86">Article 23</P>
<P class="p898 ft88">Provisions to accommodate specific characteristics of Member States' supply chains</P>
<P class="p538 ft80">Member States may require, where necessary to accommodate the particular characteristics of the supply chain on their territory, that a wholesaler verifies the safety features and decommissions the unique identifier of a medicinal product before he supplies that medicinal product to any of the following persons or institutions:</P>
<P class="p899 ft82"><SPAN class="ft91">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft117">persons authorised or entitled to supply medicinal products to the public who do not operate within a healthcare institution or within a pharmacy;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p608 ft82"><SPAN class="ft91">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft104">veterinarians and retailers of veterinary medicinal products;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p542 ft82"><SPAN class="ft91">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft117">dental practitioners;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p542 ft82"><SPAN class="ft91">(d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft104">optometrists and opticians;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p542 ft82"><SPAN class="ft91">(e)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft117">paramedics and emergency medical practitioners;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p896 ft82"><SPAN class="ft91">(f)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft112">armed forces, police and other governmental institutions maintaining stocks of medicinal products for the purposes of civil protection and disaster control;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p900 ft82"><SPAN class="ft91">(g)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft104">universities and other higher education establishments using medicinal products for the purposes of research and education, with the exceptions of healthcare institutions;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p608 ft82"><SPAN class="ft91">(h)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft104">prisons;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p542 ft82"><SPAN class="ft91">(i)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft112">schools;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p542 ft82"><SPAN class="ft91">(j)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft112">hospices;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p542 ft82"><SPAN class="ft80">(k)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft104">nursing homes.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p901 ft86">Article 24</P>
<P class="p902 ft88">Actions to be taken by wholesalers in case of tampering or suspected falsification</P>
<P class="p538 ft80">A wholesaler shall not supply or export a medicinal product where he has reason to believe that its packaging has been tampered with, or where the verification of the safety features of the medicinal product indicates that the product may not be authentic. He shall immediately inform the relevant competent authorities.</P>
<P class="p714 ft80">CHAPTER VI</P>
<P class="p903 ft89">MODALITIES OF VERIFICATION OF THE SAFETY FEATURES AND DECOMMISSIONING OF THE UNIQUE IDENTIFIER BY PERSONS AUTHORISED OR ENTITLED TO SUPPLY MEDICINAL PRODUCTS TO THE PUBLIC</P>
<P class="p904 ft86">Article 25</P>
<P class="p905 ft88">Obligations of persons authorised or entitled to supply medicinal products to the public</P>
<P class="p629 ft82"><SPAN class="ft80">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft115">Persons authorised or entitled to supply medicinal products to the public shall verify the safety features and decommission the unique identifier of any medicinal product bearing the safety features they supply to the public at the time of supplying it to the public.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p906 ft80"><SPAN class="ft80">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft116">Notwithstanding paragraph 1, persons authorised or entitled to supply medicinal products to the public operating within a healthcare institution may carry out that verification and decommissioning at any time the medicinal product is in the physical possession of the healthcare institution, provided that no sale of the medicinal product takes place between the delivery of the product to the healthcare institution and the supplying of it to the public.</SPAN></P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p13 ft79">122</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_123">
<DIV id="p123dimg1">
<INGENBILD zsrc="H603106123x1.jpg/" id="p123img1">
</DIV>


<DIV class="dclr"></DIV>
<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p437 ft79">Prop. 2018/19:106</P>
<P class="p438 ft79">Bilaga 2</P>
<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t49">
<TR>
	<TD rowspan=2 class="tr31 td83"><P class="p1 ft82">L 32/14</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr7 td109"><P class="p1 ft81"> </P></TD>
	<TD rowspan=2 class="tr31 td169"><P class="p787 ft82">Official Journal of the European Union</P></TD>
	<TD rowspan=2 class="tr31 td33"><P class="p10 ft82">9.2.2016</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr21 td111"><P class="p326 ft83">EN</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr27 td112"><P class="p1 ft84"> </P></TD>
	<TD class="tr27 td109"><P class="p1 ft84"> </P></TD>
	<TD class="tr27 td170"><P class="p1 ft84"> </P></TD>
	<TD class="tr27 td171"><P class="p1 ft84"> </P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p907 ft93"><SPAN class="ft80">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft118">In order to verify the authenticity of the unique identifier of a medicinal product and decommission that unique identifier, persons authorised or entitled to supply medicinal products to the public shall connect to the repositories system referred to in Article 31 through the national or supranational repository serving the territory of the Member State in which they are authorised or entitled.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p522 ft82"><SPAN class="ft80">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft107">They shall also verify the safety features and decommission the unique identifier of the following medicinal products bearing the safety features:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p513 ft82"><SPAN class="ft91">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft104">medicinal products in their physical possession that cannot be returned to wholesalers or manufacturers;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p865 ft82"><SPAN class="ft91">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft105">medicinal products that, while in their physical possession, are requested as samples by competent authorities, in accordance with national legislation;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p908 ft80"><SPAN class="ft91">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft113">medicinal products which they supply for subsequent use as authorised investigational medicinal products or authorised auxiliary medicinal products as defined in Articles 2(2)(9) and (10) of Regulation (EU) No 536/2014.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p909 ft86">Article 26</P>
<P class="p731 ft88">Derogations from Article 25</P>
<P class="p649 ft82"><SPAN class="ft80">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft107">Persons authorised or entitled to supply medicinal products to the public are exempted from the obligation to verify the safety features and decommission the unique identifier of medicinal products provided to them as free samples in accordance with Article 96 of Directive 2001/83/EC.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p910 ft93"><SPAN class="ft80">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft118">Persons authorised or entitled to supply medicinal products to the public who do not operate within a healthcare institution or within a pharmacy are exempted from the obligation to verify the safety features and decommission the unique identifier of medicinal products where that obligation has been placed on wholesalers by national legislation in accordance with Article 23.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p613 ft80"><SPAN class="ft80">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft120">Notwithstanding Article 25, Member States may decide, where necessary to accommodate the particular character­ istics of the supply chain on their territory, to exempt a person authorised or entitled to supply medicinal products to the public operating within a healthcare institution from the obligations of verification and decommissioning of the unique identifier, provided that the following conditions are met:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p911 ft80"><SPAN class="ft91">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft113">the person authorised or entitled to supply medicinal products to the public obtains the medicinal product bearing the unique identifier through a wholesaler belonging to the same legal entity as the healthcare institution;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p912 ft82"><SPAN class="ft91">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft105">the verification and decommissioning of the unique identifier is performed by the wholesaler that supplies the product to the healthcare institution;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p913 ft82"><SPAN class="ft91">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft104">no sale of the medicinal product takes place between the wholesaler supplying the product and that healthcare institution;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p575 ft82"><SPAN class="ft91">(d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft105">the medicinal product is supplied to the public within that healthcare institution.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p914 ft86">Article 27</P>
<P class="p915 ft88">Obligations when applying the derogations</P>
<P class="p649 ft82">Where the verification of the authenticity and decommissioning of the unique identifier is carried out earlier than referred to in Article 25(1), pursuant to Articles 23 or 26, the integrity of the <NOBR>anti-tampering</NOBR> device shall be verified at the time the medicinal product is supplied to the public.</P>
<P class="p916 ft86">Article 28</P>
<P class="p917 ft88">Obligations when supplying only part of a pack</P>
<P class="p724 ft80">Notwithstanding Article 25(1), where persons authorised or entitled to supply medicinal products to the public supply only part of a pack of a medicinal product the unique identifier of which is not decommissioned, they shall verify the safety features and decommission that unique identifier when the pack is opened for the first time.</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p13 ft79">123</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_124">
<DIV id="p124dimg1">
<INGENBILD zsrc="H603106124x1.jpg/" id="p124img1">
</DIV>


<DIV class="dclr"></DIV>
<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p13 ft79">Prop. 2018/19:106</P>
<P class="p13 ft79">Bilaga 2</P>
<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t48">
<TR>
	<TD rowspan=2 class="tr31 td83"><P class="p439 ft80">9.2.2016</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr7 td114"><P class="p1 ft81"> </P></TD>
	<TD rowspan=2 class="tr31 td119"><P class="p772 ft82">Official Journal of the European Union</P></TD>
	<TD rowspan=2 class="tr31 td172"><P class="p1 ft80">L 32/15</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr21 td116"><P class="p326 ft83">EN</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr27 td112"><P class="p1 ft84"> </P></TD>
	<TD class="tr27 td114"><P class="p1 ft84"> </P></TD>
	<TD class="tr27 td121"><P class="p1 ft84"> </P></TD>
	<TD class="tr27 td173"><P class="p1 ft84"> </P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p918 ft86">Article 29</P>
<P class="p919 ft88">Obligations in case of inability to verify the authenticity and decommission the unique identifier</P>
<P class="p920 ft80">Notwithstanding Article 25(1), where technical problems prevent persons authorised or entitled to supply medicinal products to the public from verifying the authenticity of and decommissioning a unique identifier at the time the medicinal product bearing that unique identifier is supplied to the public, those persons authorised or entitled to supply medicinal products to the public shall record the unique identifier and, as soon as the technical problems are solved, verify the authenticity of and decommission the unique identifier.</P>
<P class="p921 ft86">Article 30</P>
<P class="p869 ft88">Actions to be taken by persons authorised or entitled to supply medicinal products to the public</P>
<P class="p922 ft88">in case of suspected falsification</P>
<P class="p920 ft80">Where persons authorised or entitled to supply medicinal products to the public have reason to believe that the packaging of the medicinal product has been tampered with, or the verification of the safety features of the medicinal product indicates that the product may not be authentic, those persons authorised or entitled to supply medicinal products to the public shall not supply the product and shall immediately inform the relevant competent authorities.</P>
<P class="p923 ft80">CHAPTER VII</P>
<P class="p924 ft89">ESTABLISHMENT, MANAGEMENT AND ACCESSIBILITY OF THE REPOSITORIES SYSTEM</P>
<P class="p925 ft86">Article 31</P>
<P class="p926 ft88">Establishment of the repositories system</P>
<P class="p639 ft93"><SPAN class="ft80">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft122">The repositories system where the information on the safety features shall be contained, pursuant to Article 54a(2)(e) of Directive 2001/83/EC, shall be set up and managed by a </SPAN><NOBR>non-profit</NOBR> legal entity or <NOBR>non-profit</NOBR> legal entities established in the Union by manufacturers and marketing authorisation holders of medicinal products bearing the safety features.</P>
<P class="p927 ft82"><SPAN class="ft80">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft115">In setting up the repositories system, the legal entity or entities referred to in paragraph 1 shall consult at least wholesalers, persons authorised or entitled to supply medicinal products to the public and relevant national competent authorities.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p740 ft80"><SPAN class="ft80">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft116">Wholesalers and persons authorised or entitled to supply medicinal products to the public are entitled to participate in the legal entity or entities referred to in paragraph 1, on a voluntary basis, at no cost.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p928 ft82"><SPAN class="ft80">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft115">The legal entity or entities referred to on paragraph 1 shall not require manufacturers, marketing authorisation holders, wholesalers or persons authorised or entitled to supply medicinal products to the public to be members of a specific organisation or organisations in order to use the repository system.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p929 ft82"><SPAN class="ft80">5.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft115">The costs of the repositories system shall be borne by the manufacturers of medicinal products bearing the safety features, in accordance with Article 54a(2)(e) of Directive 2001/83/EC.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p930 ft86">Article 32</P>
<P class="p931 ft88">Structure of the repositories system</P>
<P class="p932 ft82"><SPAN class="ft80">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft115">The repositories system shall be composed of the following electronic repositories:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p542 ft82">(a) a central information and data router (‘hub’);</P>
<P class="p933 ft80"><SPAN class="ft91">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft113">repositories which serve the territory of one Member State (‘national repositories’) or the territory of multiple Member States (‘supranational repositories’). Those repositories shall be connected to the hub.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p656 ft82"><SPAN class="ft80">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft115">The number of national and supranational repositories shall be sufficient to ensure that the territory of every Member State is served by one national or supranational repository.</SPAN></P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p13 ft79">124</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_125">
<DIV id="p125dimg1">
<INGENBILD zsrc="H603106125x1.jpg/" id="p125img1">
</DIV>


<DIV class="dclr"></DIV>
<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p437 ft79">Prop. 2018/19:106</P>
<P class="p438 ft79">Bilaga 2</P>
<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t49">
<TR>
	<TD rowspan=2 class="tr31 td83"><P class="p1 ft82">L 32/16</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr7 td109"><P class="p1 ft81"> </P></TD>
	<TD rowspan=2 class="tr31 td169"><P class="p787 ft82">Official Journal of the European Union</P></TD>
	<TD rowspan=2 class="tr31 td33"><P class="p10 ft82">9.2.2016</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr21 td111"><P class="p326 ft83">EN</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr27 td112"><P class="p1 ft84"> </P></TD>
	<TD class="tr27 td109"><P class="p1 ft84"> </P></TD>
	<TD class="tr27 td170"><P class="p1 ft84"> </P></TD>
	<TD class="tr27 td171"><P class="p1 ft84"> </P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p673 ft82"><SPAN class="ft80">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft107">The repositories system shall comprise the necessary information technology infrastructure, hardware and software to enable the execution of the following tasks:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p934 ft82"><SPAN class="ft91">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft104">upload, collate, process, modify and store the information on the safety features that enables the verification of the authenticity and identification of medicinal products;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p935 ft80"><SPAN class="ft91">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft113">identify an individual pack of a medicinal product bearing the safety features and verify the authenticity of the unique identifier on that pack and decommission it at any point of the legal supply chain.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p623 ft80"><SPAN class="ft80">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft120">The repositories system shall include the application programming interfaces allowing wholesalers or persons authorised or entitled to supply medicinal products to the public to query the repositories system by means of software, for the purposes of verifying the authenticity of the unique identifiers and of decommissioning them in the repositories system. The application programming interfaces shall also allow national competent authorities to access the repositories system by means of software, in accordance with Article 39.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p936 ft82">The repositories system shall also include graphical user interfaces providing direct access to the repositories system in accordance with Article 35(1)(i).</P>
<P class="p676 ft82">The repositories system shall not include the physical scanning equipment used for reading the unique identifier.</P>
<P class="p862 ft86">Article 33</P>
<P class="p937 ft88">Uploading of information in the repositories system</P>
<P class="p938 ft80"><SPAN class="ft80">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft120">The marketing authorisation holder or, in case of parallel imported or parallel distributed medicinal products bearing an equivalent unique identifier for the purposes of complying with Article 47a of Directive 2001/83/EC, the person responsible for placing those medicinal products on the market, shall ensure that the information referred to in paragraph 2 is uploaded to the repositories system before the medicinal product is released for sale or distribution by the manufacturer, and that it is kept up to date thereafter.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p939 ft93">The information shall be stored in all national or supranational repositories serving the territory of the Member State or Member States where the medicinal product bearing the unique identifier is intended to be placed on the market. The information referred to in paragraphs 2(a) to (d) of this Article, with the exception of the serial number, shall also be stored in the hub.</P>
<P class="p940 ft82"><SPAN class="ft80">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft107">For a medicinal product bearing a unique identifier, at least the following information shall be uploaded to the repositories system:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p589 ft82"><SPAN class="ft91">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft117">the data elements of the unique identifier in accordance with Article 4(b);</SPAN></P>
<P class="p543 ft82"><SPAN class="ft91">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft104">the coding scheme of the product code;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p941 ft80"><SPAN class="ft91">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft127">the name and the common name of the medicinal product, the pharmaceutical form, the strength, the pack type and the pack size of the medicinal product, in accordance with the terminology referred to in Article 25(1)(b) and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p942 ft82">(e) to (g) of the Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) No 520/2012 (<SPAN class="ft90">1</SPAN>);</P>
<P class="p455 ft82"><SPAN class="ft91">(d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft104">the Member State or Member States where the medicinal product is intended to be placed on the market;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p943 ft93"><SPAN class="ft91">(e)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft106">where applicable, the code identifying the entry corresponding to the medicinal product bearing the unique identifier in the database referred to in Article 57(1)(l) of Regulation (EC) No 726/2004 of the European Parliament and the Council (</SPAN><SPAN class="ft90">2</SPAN>);</P>
<P class="p543 ft82"><SPAN class="ft91">(f)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft112">the name and address of the manufacturer placing the safety features;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p944 ft144">(<SPAN class="ft143">1</SPAN>) Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) No 520/2012 of 19 June 2012 on the performance of pharmacovigilance activities provided for in Regulation (EC) No 726/2004 of the European Parliament and of the Council and Directive 2001/83/EC of the European</P>
<P class="p945 ft96">Parliament and of the Council (OJ L 159, 20.6.2012, p. 5).</P>
<P class="p456 ft80">(<SPAN class="ft95">2</SPAN>) Regulation (EC) No 726/2004 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 31 March 2004 laying down Community procedures for the authorisation and supervision of medicinal products for human and veterinary use and establishing a European Medicines Agency (OJ L 136, 30.4.2004, p. 1).</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p13 ft79">125</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_126">
<DIV id="p126dimg1">
<INGENBILD zsrc="H603106126x1.jpg/" id="p126img1">
</DIV>


<DIV class="dclr"></DIV>
<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p13 ft79">Prop. 2018/19:106</P>
<P class="p13 ft79">Bilaga 2</P>
<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t48">
<TR>
	<TD rowspan=2 class="tr31 td83"><P class="p439 ft80">9.2.2016</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr7 td114"><P class="p1 ft81"> </P></TD>
	<TD rowspan=2 class="tr31 td119"><P class="p772 ft82">Official Journal of the European Union</P></TD>
	<TD rowspan=2 class="tr31 td172"><P class="p1 ft80">L 32/17</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr21 td116"><P class="p326 ft83">EN</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr27 td112"><P class="p1 ft84"> </P></TD>
	<TD class="tr27 td114"><P class="p1 ft84"> </P></TD>
	<TD class="tr27 td121"><P class="p1 ft84"> </P></TD>
	<TD class="tr27 td173"><P class="p1 ft84"> </P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p502 ft82"><SPAN class="ft91">(g)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft104">the name and address of the marketing authorisation holder;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p946 ft82"><SPAN class="ft91">(h)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft104">a list of wholesalers who are designated by the marketing authorisation holder, by means of a written contract, to store and distribute the products covered by his marketing authorisation on his behalf.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p947 ft82"><SPAN class="ft80">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft115">The information referred to in paragraph 2 shall be uploaded to the repositories system either through the hub or through a national or supranational repository.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p948 ft93">Where the upload is performed through the hub, the hub shall store a copy of the information referred to in paragraph 2(a) to (d), with the exception of the serial number, and transfer the complete information to all national or supranational repositories serving the territory of the Member State or Member States where the medicinal product bearing the unique identifier is intended to be placed on the market.</P>
<P class="p920 ft80">Where the upload is performed through a national or supranational repository, that repository shall immediately transfer to the hub a copy of the information referred to in paragraph 2(a) to (d), with the exception of the serial number, using the data format and data exchange specifications defined by the hub.</P>
<P class="p949 ft80"><SPAN class="ft80">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft116">The information referred to in paragraph 2 shall be stored in the repositories where it was originally uploaded for at least one year after the expiry date of the medicinal product or five years after the product has been released for sale or distribution in accordance with Article 51(3) of Directive 2001/83/EC, whichever is the longer period.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p950 ft86">Article 34</P>
<P class="p951 ft88">Functioning of the hub</P>
<P class="p661 ft82"><SPAN class="ft80">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft115">Each national or supranational repository composing the repositories system shall exchange data with the hub using the data format and data exchange modalities defined by the hub.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p952 ft80"><SPAN class="ft80">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft116">When the authenticity of the unique identifier cannot be verified because a national or supranational repository does not contain a unique identifier with the product code and serial number that are identical to those of the unique identifier being verified, the national or supranational repository shall transfer the query to the hub in order to verify whether that unique identifier is stored elsewhere in the repositories system.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p949 ft80">When the hub receives the query, the hub shall identify, on the basis of the information contained therein, all national or supranational repositories serving the territory of the Member State or Member States where the medicinal product bearing the unique identifier was intended to be placed on the market, and shall transfer the query to those repositories.</P>
<P class="p953 ft82">The hub shall subsequently transfer the reply of those repositories to the repository which initiated the query.</P>
<P class="p954 ft93"><SPAN class="ft80">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft122">Where notified by a national or supranational repository of the change of status of a unique identifier, the hub shall ensure the synchronisation of that status between those national or supranational repositories serving the territory of the Member State or Member States where the medicinal product bearing the unique identifier was intended to be placed on the market.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p636 ft82"><SPAN class="ft80">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft115">When it receives the information referred to in Article 35(4), the hub shall ensure the electronic linking of the batch numbers before and after the repackaging or </SPAN><NOBR>re-labelling</NOBR> operations with the set of unique identifiers decommis­ sioned and with the set of equivalent unique identifiers placed.</P>
<P class="p955 ft86">Article 35</P>
<P class="p956 ft88">Characteristics of the repositories system</P>
<P class="p953 ft82"><SPAN class="ft80">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft115">Each repository in the repositories system shall satisfy all of the following conditions:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p562 ft82">(a) it shall be physically located in the Union;</P>
<P class="p957 ft80"><SPAN class="ft91">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft113">it shall be set up and managed by a </SPAN><NOBR>non-profit</NOBR> legal entity established in the Union by manufacturers and marketing authorisation holders of medicinal products bearing the safety features and, where they have chosen to participate, wholesalers and persons authorised or entitled to supply medicinal products to the public;</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p13 ft79">126</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_127">
<DIV id="p127dimg1">
<INGENBILD zsrc="H603106127x1.jpg/" id="p127img1">
</DIV>


<DIV class="dclr"></DIV>
<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p437 ft79">Prop. 2018/19:106</P>
<P class="p438 ft79">Bilaga 2</P>
<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t49">
<TR>
	<TD rowspan=2 class="tr31 td83"><P class="p1 ft82">L 32/18</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr7 td109"><P class="p1 ft81"> </P></TD>
	<TD rowspan=2 class="tr31 td169"><P class="p787 ft82">Official Journal of the European Union</P></TD>
	<TD rowspan=2 class="tr31 td33"><P class="p10 ft82">9.2.2016</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr21 td111"><P class="p326 ft83">EN</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr27 td112"><P class="p1 ft84"> </P></TD>
	<TD class="tr27 td109"><P class="p1 ft84"> </P></TD>
	<TD class="tr27 td170"><P class="p1 ft84"> </P></TD>
	<TD class="tr27 td171"><P class="p1 ft84"> </P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p943 ft82"><SPAN class="ft91">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft117">it shall be fully interoperable with the other repositories composing the repositories system; for the purposes of this Chapter, interoperability means the full functional integration of, and electronic data exchange between repositories regardless of the service provider used;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p842 ft82"><SPAN class="ft91">(d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft104">it shall allow the reliable electronic identification and authentication of individual packs of medicinal products by manufacturers, wholesalers and persons authorised or entitled to supply medicinal products to the public, in accordance with the requirements of this Regulation;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p842 ft93"><SPAN class="ft91">(e)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft106">it shall have application programming interfaces able to transfer and exchange data with the software used by wholesalers, persons authorised or entitled to supply medicinal products to the public and, where applicable, national competent authorities;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p958 ft80"><SPAN class="ft91">(f)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft128">when wholesalers and persons authorised or entitled to supply medicinal products to the public query the repository for the purposes of verification of authenticity and decommissioning of a unique identifier, the response time of the repository, not considering the speed of the internet connection, shall be lower than 300 milliseconds in at least 95 % of queries. The repository performance shall allow wholesalers and persons authorised or entitled to supply medicinal products to the public to operate without significant delay;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p941 ft80"><SPAN class="ft91">(g)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft113">it shall maintain a complete record (‘audit trail’) of all operations concerning a unique identifier, of the users performing those operations and the nature of the operations; the audit trail shall be created when the unique identifier is uploaded to the repository and be maintained until at least one year after the expiry date of the medicinal product bearing the unique identifier or five years after the product has been released for sale or distribution in accordance with Article 51(3) of Directive 2001/83/EC, whichever is the longer period;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p959 ft93"><SPAN class="ft91">(h)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft121">in accordance with Article 38, its structure shall be such as to guarantee the protection of personal data and information of a commercially confidential nature and the ownership and confidentiality of the data generated when manufacturers, marketing authorisation holders, wholesalers and persons authorised or entitled to supply medicinal products to the public interact with it;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p841 ft82"><SPAN class="ft91">(i)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft112">it shall include graphical user interfaces providing direct access to it to the following users verified in accordance with Article 37(b):</SPAN></P>
<P class="p960 ft82"><SPAN class="ft91">(i)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft117">wholesalers and persons authorised or entitled to supply medicinal products to the public, for the purposes of verifying the authenticity of the unique identifier and decommissioning it in case of failure of their own software;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p961 ft82"><SPAN class="ft91">(ii)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft105">national competent authorities, for the purposes referred to in Article 39;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p962 ft93"><SPAN class="ft80">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft118">Where the status of a unique identifier on a medicinal product intended to be placed on the market in more than one Member State changes in a national or supranational repository, that repository shall immediately notify the change of status to the hub, except in case of decommissioning by marketing authorisation holders in accordance with Articles 40 or 41.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p546 ft82"><SPAN class="ft80">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft107">National or supranational repositories shall not allow the upload or storage of a unique identifier containing the same product code and serial number as another unique identifier already stored therein.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p963 ft102"><SPAN class="ft80">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft136">For each batch of repackaged or relabelled packs of a medicinal product on which equivalent unique identifiers were placed for the purposes of complying with Article 47a of Directive 2001/83/EC, the person responsible for placing the medicinal product on the market shall inform the hub of the batch number or numbers of the packs which are to be repackaged or relabelled and of the unique identifiers on those packs. He shall additionally inform the hub of the batch number of the batch resulting from the repackaging or </SPAN><NOBR>re-labelling</NOBR> operations and the equivalent unique identifiers in that batch.</P>
<P class="p862 ft86">Article 36</P>
<P class="p964 ft88">Operations of the repositories system</P>
<P class="p676 ft82">The repositories system shall provide for at least the following operations:</P>
<P class="p515 ft82"><SPAN class="ft91">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft131">the repeated verification of the authenticity of an active unique identifier in accordance with Article 11;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p965 ft80"><SPAN class="ft91">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft128">the triggering of an alert in the system and in the terminal where the verification of the authenticity of a unique identifier is taking place when such verification fails to confirm that the unique identifier is authentic in accordance with Article 11. Such an event shall be flagged in the system as a potential incident of falsification except where the product is indicated in the system as recalled, withdrawn or intended for destruction;</SPAN></P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p13 ft79">127</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_128">
<DIV id="p128dimg1">
<INGENBILD zsrc="H603106128x1.jpg/" id="p128img1">
</DIV>


<DIV class="dclr"></DIV>
<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p13 ft79">Prop. 2018/19:106</P>
<P class="p13 ft79">Bilaga 2</P>
<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t48">
<TR>
	<TD rowspan=2 class="tr31 td83"><P class="p439 ft80">9.2.2016</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr7 td114"><P class="p1 ft81"> </P></TD>
	<TD rowspan=2 class="tr31 td119"><P class="p772 ft82">Official Journal of the European Union</P></TD>
	<TD rowspan=2 class="tr31 td172"><P class="p1 ft80">L 32/19</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr21 td116"><P class="p326 ft83">EN</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr27 td112"><P class="p1 ft84"> </P></TD>
	<TD class="tr27 td114"><P class="p1 ft84"> </P></TD>
	<TD class="tr27 td121"><P class="p1 ft84"> </P></TD>
	<TD class="tr27 td173"><P class="p1 ft84"> </P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p502 ft82"><SPAN class="ft91">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft131">the decommissioning of a unique identifier in accordance with the requirements of this Regulation;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p966 ft82"><SPAN class="ft91">(d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft112">the combined operations of identification of a pack of a medicinal product bearing a unique identifier and verification of the authenticity and decommissioning of that unique identifier;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p967 ft82"><SPAN class="ft91">(e)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft131">the identification of a pack of a medicinal product bearing a unique identifier and the verification of the authenticity and the decommissioning of that unique identifier in a Member State which is not the Member State where the medicinal product bearing that unique identifier was placed on the market;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p968 ft82"><SPAN class="ft91">(f)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft132">the reading of the information contained in the </SPAN><NOBR>two-dimensional</NOBR> barcode encoding the unique identifier, the identi­ fication of the medicinal product carrying the barcode and the verification of the status of the unique identifier, without triggering the alert referred to in point (b) of this Article;</P>
<P class="p969 ft93"><SPAN class="ft91">(g)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft145">without prejudice to Article 35(1)(h), the access by verified wholesalers to the list of wholesalers referred to in Article 33(2)(h) for the purposes of determining whether they have to verify the unique identifier of a given medicinal product.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p970 ft82"><SPAN class="ft91">(h)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft112">the verification of the authenticity of a unique identifier and its decommissioning by manually querying the system with the data elements of the unique identifier;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p971 ft82"><SPAN class="ft91">(i)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft132">the immediate provision of information concerning a given unique identifier to the national competent authorities and the European Medicines Agency, upon request;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p972 ft80"><SPAN class="ft91">(j)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft142">the creation of reports that allow competent authorities to verify compliance of individual marketing authorisation holders, manufacturers, wholesalers and persons authorised or entitled to supply medicinal products to the public with the requirements of this Regulation or to investigate potential incidents of falsification;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p973 ft82"><SPAN class="ft80">(k)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft112">the reverting of the status of a unique identifier from decommissioned to active, subject to the conditions referred to in Article 13;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p562 ft82"><SPAN class="ft91">(l)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft132">the indication that a unique identifier has been decommissioned;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p974 ft82"><SPAN class="ft80">(m)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft105">the indication that a medicinal product has been recalled, withdrawn, stolen, exported, requested as a sample by national competent authorities, indicated as a free sample by the marketing authorisation holder, or is intended for destruction;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p968 ft82"><SPAN class="ft91">(n)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft112">the linking, by batches of medicinal products, of the information on unique identifiers removed or covered to the information on the equivalent unique identifiers placed on those medicinal products for the purposes of complying with Article 47a of Directive 2001/83/EC.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p975 ft80"><SPAN class="ft91">(o)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft128">the synchronisation of the status of a unique identifier between the national or supranational repositories serving the territory of the Member States where that medicinal product is intended to be placed on the market.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p976 ft86">Article 37</P>
<P class="p977 ft88">Obligations of legal entities establishing and managing a repository which is part of the</P>
<P class="p978 ft88">repositories system</P>
<P class="p561 ft82">Any legal entity establishing and managing a repository which is part of the repositories system shall perform the following actions:</P>
<P class="p979 ft82"><SPAN class="ft91">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft117">inform the relevant national competent authorities of its intention to physically locate the repository or part of it in their territory and notify them once the repository becomes operational;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p979 ft82"><SPAN class="ft91">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft104">put in place security procedures ensuring that only users whose identity, role and legitimacy has been verified can access the repository or upload the information referred to in Article 33(2);</SPAN></P>
<P class="p980 ft82"><SPAN class="ft91">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft117">continuously monitor the repository for events alerting to potential incidents of falsification in accordance to Article 36(b);</SPAN></P>
<P class="p981 ft93"><SPAN class="ft91">(d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft121">provide for the immediate investigation of all potential incidents of falsification flagged in the system in accordance with Article 36(b) and for the alerting of national competent authorities, the European Medicines Agency and the Commission should the falsification be confirmed;</SPAN></P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p13 ft79">128</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_129">
<DIV id="p129dimg1">
<INGENBILD zsrc="H603106129x1.jpg/" id="p129img1">
</DIV>


<DIV class="dclr"></DIV>
<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p437 ft79">Prop. 2018/19:106</P>
<P class="p438 ft79">Bilaga 2</P>
<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t49">
<TR>
	<TD rowspan=2 class="tr31 td83"><P class="p1 ft82">L 32/20</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr7 td109"><P class="p1 ft81"> </P></TD>
	<TD rowspan=2 class="tr31 td169"><P class="p787 ft82">Official Journal of the European Union</P></TD>
	<TD rowspan=2 class="tr31 td33"><P class="p10 ft82">9.2.2016</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr21 td111"><P class="p326 ft83">EN</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr27 td112"><P class="p1 ft84"> </P></TD>
	<TD class="tr27 td109"><P class="p1 ft84"> </P></TD>
	<TD class="tr27 td170"><P class="p1 ft84"> </P></TD>
	<TD class="tr27 td171"><P class="p1 ft84"> </P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p982 ft80"><SPAN class="ft91">(e)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft113">carry out regular audits of the repository to verify compliance with the requirements of this Regulation. Audits shall take place at least annually for the first five years after this Regulation becomes applicable in the Member State where the repository is physically located, and at least every three years thereafter. The outcome of those audits shall be provided to competent authorities upon request;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p455 ft82"><SPAN class="ft91">(f)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft117">make the audit trail referred to in Article 35(1)(g) immediately available to competent authorities upon their request;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p543 ft82"><SPAN class="ft91">(g)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft105">make the reports referred to in Article 36(j) available to competent authorities upon their request.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p983 ft86">Article 38</P>
<P class="p984 ft88">Data protection and data ownership</P>
<P class="p846 ft80"><SPAN class="ft80">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft120">Manufacturers, marketing authorisation holders, wholesalers and persons authorised or entitled to supply medicinal products to the public shall be responsible for any data generated when they interact with the repositories system and stored in the audit trail. They shall only have ownership of and access to those data, with the exception of the information referred to in Article 33(2) and the information on the status of a unique identifier.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p846 ft80"><SPAN class="ft80">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft120">The legal entity managing the repository where the audit trail is stored shall not access the audit trail and the data contained therein without the written agreement of the legitimate data owners except for the purpose of investigating potential incidents of falsification flagged in the system in accordance with Article 36(b).</SPAN></P>
<P class="p862 ft86">Article 39</P>
<P class="p985 ft88">Access by national competent authorities</P>
<P class="p554 ft80">A legal entity establishing and managing a repository used to verify the authenticity of or decommission the unique identifiers of medicinal products placed on the market in a Member State shall grant access to that repository and to the information contained therein, to competent authorities of that Member State for the following purposes:</P>
<P class="p455 ft82"><SPAN class="ft91">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft104">supervising the functioning of the repositories and investigating potential incidents of falsification;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p589 ft82"><SPAN class="ft91">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft105">reimbursement;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p543 ft82"><SPAN class="ft91">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft104">pharmacovigilance or pharmacoepidemiology.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p986 ft80">CHAPTER VIII</P>
<P class="p746 ft89">OBLIGATIONS OF MARKETING AUTHORISATION HOLDERS, PARALLEL IMPORTERS AND PARALLEL</P>
<P class="p987 ft89">DISTRIBUTORS</P>
<P class="p762 ft86">Article 40</P>
<P class="p988 ft88">Products recalled, withdrawn or stolen</P>
<P class="p554 ft80">The marketing authorisation holder or, in case of parallel imported or parallel distributed medicinal products bearing an equivalent unique identifier for the purposes of complying with Article 47a of Directive 2001/83/EC, the person responsible for placing those medicinal products on the market shall promptly take all the following measures:</P>
<P class="p702 ft82"><SPAN class="ft91">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft117">ensure the decommissioning of the unique identifier of a medicinal product which is to be recalled or withdrawn, in every national or supranational repository serving the territory of the Member State or Member States in which the recall or the withdrawal is to take place;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p989 ft80"><SPAN class="ft91">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft113">ensure the decommissioning of the unique identifier, where known, of a medicinal product which has been stolen, in every national or supranational repository in which information on that product is stored;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p816 ft82"><SPAN class="ft91">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft117">indicate in the repositories referred to in points (a) and (b) that that product has been recalled or withdrawn or stolen, where applicable.</SPAN></P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p13 ft79">129</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_130">
<DIV id="p130dimg1">
<INGENBILD zsrc="H603106130x1.jpg/" id="p130img1">
</DIV>


<DIV class="dclr"></DIV>
<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p13 ft79">Prop. 2018/19:106</P>
<P class="p13 ft79">Bilaga 2</P>
<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t48">
<TR>
	<TD rowspan=2 class="tr31 td83"><P class="p439 ft80">9.2.2016</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr7 td114"><P class="p1 ft81"> </P></TD>
	<TD rowspan=2 class="tr31 td119"><P class="p772 ft82">Official Journal of the European Union</P></TD>
	<TD rowspan=2 class="tr31 td172"><P class="p1 ft80">L 32/21</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr21 td116"><P class="p326 ft83">EN</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr27 td112"><P class="p1 ft84"> </P></TD>
	<TD class="tr27 td114"><P class="p1 ft84"> </P></TD>
	<TD class="tr27 td121"><P class="p1 ft84"> </P></TD>
	<TD class="tr27 td173"><P class="p1 ft84"> </P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p918 ft86">Article 41</P>
<P class="p990 ft88">Products to be supplied as free samples</P>
<P class="p991 ft93">The marketing authorisation holder intending to supply any of his medicinal products as a free sample in accordance with Article 96 of Directive 2001/83/EC shall, where that product bears the safety features, indicate it as a free sample in the repositories system and ensure the decommissioning of its unique identifier before providing it to the persons qualified to prescribe it.</P>
<P class="p921 ft86">Article 42</P>
<P class="p992 ft88">Removal of unique identifiers from the repositories system</P>
<P class="p949 ft80">The marketing authorisation holder or, in case of parallel imported or parallel distributed medicinal products bearing an equivalent unique identifier for the purposes of complying with Article 47a of Directive 2001/83/EC, the person responsible for placing those medicinal products on the market shall not upload unique identifiers in the repositories system before having removed from therein, where present, older unique identifiers containing the same product code and serial number as the unique identifiers being uploaded.</P>
<P class="p993 ft80">CHAPTER IX</P>
<P class="p994 ft89">OBLIGATIONS OF THE NATIONAL COMPETENT AUTHORITIES</P>
<P class="p995 ft86">Article 43</P>
<P class="p996 ft88">Information to be provided by national competent authorities</P>
<P class="p741 ft93">National competent authorities shall make the following information available to the marketing authorisation holders, manufacturers, wholesalers and persons authorised or entitled to supply medicinal products to the public, upon their request:</P>
<P class="p979 ft82"><SPAN class="ft91">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft117">the medicinal products placed on the market on their territory which shall bear the safety features in accordance with Article 54(o) of Directive 2001/83/EC and this Regulation;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p997 ft82"><SPAN class="ft91">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft104">the medicinal products subject to prescription or subject to reimbursement for which the scope of the unique identifier is extended for the purposes of reimbursement or pharmacovigilance, in accordance with Article 54a(5) of Directive 2001/83/EC;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p827 ft82"><SPAN class="ft91">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft117">the medicinal products for which the scope of the </SPAN><NOBR>anti-tampering</NOBR> device is extended for the purpose of patient safety, in accordance with Article 54a(5) of Directive 2001/83/EC.</P>
<P class="p871 ft86">Article 44</P>
<P class="p998 ft88">Supervision of the repositories system</P>
<P class="p999 ft80"><SPAN class="ft80">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft116">National competent authorities shall supervise the functioning of any repository physically located in their territory, in order to verify, if necessary by means of inspections, that the repository and the legal entity responsible for the establishment and management of the repository comply with the requirements of this Regulation.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p661 ft82"><SPAN class="ft80">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft115">A national competent authority may delegate any of its obligations under this Article to the competent authority of another Member State or to a third party, by means of a written agreement.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p594 ft80"><SPAN class="ft80">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft116">Where a repository not physically located in the territory of a Member State is used for the purpose of verifying the authenticity of medicinal products placed on the market in that Member State, the competent authority of that Member State may observe an inspection of the repository or perform an independent inspection, subject to the agreement of the Member State in which the repository is physically located.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1000 ft80"><SPAN class="ft80">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft116">A national competent authority shall communicate reports of supervision activities to the European Medicines Agency, which shall make them available to the other national competent authorities and the Commission.</SPAN></P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p13 ft79">130</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_131">
<DIV id="p131dimg1">
<INGENBILD zsrc="H603106131x1.jpg/" id="p131img1">
</DIV>


<DIV class="dclr"></DIV>
<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p437 ft79">Prop. 2018/19:106</P>
<P class="p438 ft79">Bilaga 2</P>
<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t49">
<TR>
	<TD rowspan=2 class="tr31 td83"><P class="p1 ft82">L 32/22</P></TD>
	<TD class="tr7 td109"><P class="p1 ft81"> </P></TD>
	<TD rowspan=2 class="tr31 td169"><P class="p787 ft82">Official Journal of the European Union</P></TD>
	<TD rowspan=2 class="tr31 td33"><P class="p10 ft82">9.2.2016</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr21 td111"><P class="p326 ft83">EN</P></TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr27 td112"><P class="p1 ft84"> </P></TD>
	<TD class="tr27 td109"><P class="p1 ft84"> </P></TD>
	<TD class="tr27 td170"><P class="p1 ft84"> </P></TD>
	<TD class="tr27 td171"><P class="p1 ft84"> </P></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p677 ft82"><SPAN class="ft80">5.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft107">National competent authorities may contribute to the management of any repository used to identify medicinal products and verify the authenticity of or decommission the unique identifiers of medicinal products placed on the market in the territory of their Member State.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1001 ft82">National competent authorities may participate to the management board of the legal entities managing those repositories to the extent of up to one third of the members of the board.</P>
<P class="p1002 ft80">CHAPTER X</P>
<P class="p1003 ft89">LISTS OF DEROGATIONS AND NOTIFICATIONS TO THE COMMISSION</P>
<P class="p1004 ft86">Article 45</P>
<P class="p1005 ft88">Lists of derogations from bearing or not bearing the safety features</P>
<P class="p522 ft82"><SPAN class="ft80">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft107">The list of medicinal products or product categories subject to prescription which shall not bear the safety features are set out in Annex I to this Regulation.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1006 ft82"><SPAN class="ft80">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft107">The list of medicinal products or product categories not subject to prescription which shall bear the safety features are set out in Annex II to this Regulation.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p884 ft86">Article 46</P>
<P class="p1007 ft88">Notifications to the Commission</P>
<P class="p1008 ft82"><SPAN class="ft80">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft107">National competent authorities shall notify the Commission of </SPAN><NOBR>non-prescription</NOBR> medicinal products which they judge to be at risk of falsification as soon as they become aware of such risk. For that purpose, they shall use the form set out in Annex III to this Regulation.</P>
<P class="p1009 ft80"><SPAN class="ft80">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft120">National competent authorities may inform the Commission of medicinal products which they deem not to be at risk of falsification. For that purpose, they shall use the form set out in Annex IV to this Regulation.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1008 ft82"><SPAN class="ft80">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft107">For the purposes of the notifications referred to in paragraphs 1 and 2, national competent authorities shall conduct an assessment of the risks of and arising from falsification of such products taking into account the criteria listed in Article 54a(2)(b) of Directive 2001/83/EC.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1009 ft80"><SPAN class="ft80">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft120">When submitting to the Commission the notification referred to in paragraph 1, national competent authorities shall provide the Commission with evidence and documentation supporting the presence of incidents of falsification.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1010 ft86">Article 47</P>
<P class="p1011 ft88">Evaluation of the notifications</P>
<P class="p677 ft93">Where, following a notification as referred to in Article 46, the Commission or a Member State considers, on the basis of casualties or hospitalisations of citizens of the Union due to exposure to falsified medicinal products, that rapid action is required to protect public health, the Commission shall asses the notification without delay and at the latest within 45 days.</P>
<P class="p1012 ft80">CHAPTER XI</P>
<P class="p1013 ft89">TRANSITIONAL MEASURES AND ENTRY INTO FORCE</P>
<P class="p1014 ft86">Article 48</P>
<P class="p1015 ft88">Transitional measures</P>
<P class="p677 ft93">Medicinal products that have been released for sale or distribution without the safety features in a Member State before the date in which this Regulation becomes applicable in that Member State, and are not repackaged or relabelled thereafter, may be placed on the market, distributed and supplied to the public in that Member State until their expiry date.</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p13 ft79">131</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_132">
<DIV id="p132dimg1">

</DIV>

	<TD class="tr7 td114"><P class="p1 ft81"> </P></TD>
	<TD rowspan=2 class="tr31 td119"><P class="p772 ft82">Official Journal of the European Union</P></TD>
	<TD rowspan=2 class="tr31 td172"><P class="p1 ft80">L 32/23</P></TD>

<TR>

	<TD class="tr27 td173"><P class="p1 ft84"> </P></TD>

<P class="p918 ft86">Article 49</P>
<P class="p757 ft88">Application in Member States with existing systems for the verification of the authenticity of</P>
<P class="p114 ft88">medicinal products and for the identification of individual pack<SPAN class="ft146">s</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1016 ft80"><SPAN class="ft80">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft116">Each of the Member States referred to in Article 2, paragraph 2, second subparagraph, point (b), second sentence, of Directive 2011/62/EU shall notify the Commission of the date from which Articles 1 to 48 of this Regulation apply in its territory in accordance with the third subparagraph of Article 50. The notification shall take place at the latest</SPAN></P>
<P class="p17 ft82"><SPAN class="ft82">6</SPAN><SPAN class="ft130">months before that application.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p1017 ft82"><SPAN class="ft80">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft115">The Commission shall publish a notice of each of the dates notified to it in accordance with paragraph 1 in the </SPAN><SPAN class="ft86">Official Journal of the European Union</SPAN>.</P>
<P class="p1018 ft86">Article 50</P>
<P class="p1019 ft88">Entry into force</P>
<P class="p1020 ft82">This Regulation shall enter into force on the twentieth day following that of its publication in the <SPAN class="ft86">Official Journal of the European Union</SPAN>.</P>
<P class="p498 ft82">It shall apply from 9 February 2019.</P>
<P class="p1021 ft80">However, the Member States referred to in Article 2, paragraph 2, second subparagraph, point (b), second sentence, of Directive 2011/62/EU shall apply Articles 1 to 48 of this Regulation at the latest from 9 February 2025.</P>
<P class="p1022 ft82">This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.</P>
<P class="p1023 ft82">Done at Brussels, 2 October 2015.</P>
<P class="p1024 ft86">For the Commission</P>
<P class="p1025 ft86">The President</P>
<P class="p1026 ft80"><NOBR>Jean-Claude</NOBR> JUNCKER</P>
</DIV>

<P class="p1039 ft151">Sammanfattning av promemorian Anpassningar av svensk lag med anledning av kommissionens delegerade förordning (EU) 2016/161</P>
<P class="p1040 ft1">(Ds 2018:27)</P>
<P class="p1041 ft4">Promemorian innehåller förslag till lagändringar som syftar till att anpassa svensk rätt till kommissionens delegerade förordning (EU) nr 2016/161 av den 2 oktober 2015 om komplettering av Europaparlamentets och rådets direktiv 2001/83/EG genom fastställande av närmare bestämmelser om de säkerhetsdetaljer som anges på förpackningar för humanläkemedel. Utöver de lagförslag som syftar till sådan anpassning av svensk rätt lämnas även förslag till vissa följdändringar i lagar samt i lagar om ändring i vissa lagar. Lagförslagen avser lagen (2009:366) om handel med läkemedel, läkemedelslagen (2015:315) och lagen (2009:730) om handel med vissa receptfria läkemedel.</P>
<P class="p1042 ft4">Anpassningarna innebär bl.a. nationella bestämmelser som motsvarar materiella bestämmelser i <NOBR>EU-förordningen</NOBR> tas bort. För att säkerställa <NOBR>EU-förordningens</NOBR> verkan utökas Läkemedelsverkets tillsynsansvar och kommuners ansvar för kontroll. Av samma skäl införs bestämmelser som innebär att tillstånd till tillverkning, tillstånd till partihandel och tillstånd till detaljhandel med läkemedel till konsument ska kunna återkallas om tillståndshavaren i väsentlig grad åsidosätter krav som följer av EU- förordningen. Rätten för regeringen eller den myndighet som regeringen bestämmer att meddela föreskrifter föreslås också ändras.</P>
<P class="p1043 ft10">Bestämmelserna om säkerhetsdetaljer i direktiv 2001/83/EU och bestäm- melserna i förordning (EU) 2016/161 bedöms inte kräva någon annan anpassning av svensk lag än de lagförslag som lämnas i promemorian.</P>
<P class="p330 ft10"><NOBR>EU-förordningen</NOBR> ska tillämpas från och med den 9 februari 2019. Lag- ändringarna föreslås träda i kraft den 1 januari 2019. Ett av förslagen om ändring i lagen om ändring i lagen om handel med läkemedel träder i kraft den 1 juni 2020 och lagen om ändring i lagen om ändring i läkemedels- lagen träder i kraft den dag som regeringen bestämmer.</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_1_2">

<P class="p322 ft4">Bilaga 3</P>

<P class="p1045 ft19">Förslag till lag om ändring i lagen (2009:366) om handel med läkemedel</P>
<P class="p1046 ft10">Härigenom föreskrivs i fråga om lagen (2009:366) om handel med läke- medel</P>
<P class="p42 ft4"><SPAN class="ft5">dels </SPAN>att 3 kap. 3 a § ska upphöra att gälla,</P>
<P class="p1047 ft6"><SPAN class="ft7">dels </SPAN>att 1 kap. 5 §, 3 kap. 5 §, 4 kap. 2 §, 7 kap. 1 och 3 §§ samt 8 kap. <NOBR>3–4</NOBR> §§, ska ha följande lydelse.</P>

<P class="p1053 ft73"><SPAN class="ft153">4</SPAN><SPAN class="ft152">kap. 2 §</SPAN><SPAN class="ft154">2</SPAN></P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<DIV id="id_2_1">
<P class="p293 ft4">Den som bedriver detaljhandel enligt 1 § ska</P>
<P class="p40 ft21"><SPAN class="ft37">1</SPAN>. till <NOBR>E-hälsomyndigheten</NOBR> lämna de uppgifter som är nödvändiga för att myndigheten ska kunna föra statistik över detaljhandeln, och</P>
<P class="p244 ft45"><SPAN class="ft5">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft44">kontrollera sådana säkerhets- detaljer som avses i 4 kap. 1 § andra stycket läkemedelslagen (2015:315) på de humanläkemedel som tillståndshavaren hanterar.</SPAN></P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2_2">
<P class="p89 ft10">Den som bedriver detaljhandel enligt 1 § ska <SPAN class="ft24">till </SPAN><NOBR><SPAN class="ft24">E-hälsomyndig-</SPAN></NOBR><SPAN class="ft24"> heten lämna de uppgifter som är nödvändiga för att myndigheten ska kunna föra statistik över detalj- handeln.</SPAN></P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_3">
<P class="p1054 ft73"><SPAN class="ft153">7</SPAN><SPAN class="ft152">kap. 1 §</SPAN></P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_4">
<DIV id="id_4_1">
<P class="p1055 ft10">Läkemedelsverket har tillsyn över efterlevnaden av denna lag och av <SPAN class="ft24">de </SPAN>föreskrifter och villkor som har meddelats i anslutning till lagen.</P>
<P class="p1056 ft23">3 §</P>
<P class="p1057 ft4">Läkemedelsverket får meddela de förelägganden och förbud som behövs för att <SPAN class="ft5">denna lag eller föreskrifter och villkor som har meddelats i anslutning till lagen </SPAN>ska efterlevas. <SPAN class="ft5">Beslut om före- läggande eller förbud får förenas med vite</SPAN>.</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_4_2">
<P class="p40 ft10">Läkemedelsverket har tillsyn över efterlevnaden av <SPAN class="ft24">föreskrif- terna i </SPAN>denna lag och <SPAN class="ft24">i kommis- sionens delegerade förordning (EU) 2016/161 samt </SPAN>av föreskrifter och villkor som har meddelats i anslutning till lagen.</P>
<P class="p1058 ft4">Läkemedelsverket får meddela de förelägganden och förbud som behövs för att sådana föreskrifter och villkor som anges i 1 § ska efterlevas.</P>
<P class="p342 ft7">Beslut om föreläggande eller för- bud får förenas med vite<SPAN class="ft6">.</SPAN></P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
